moves.1. c4 e5 2. Nc3 Nc6: The English -- so far, so standard.
moves.3. g3: Unusual, but playable. The fianchetto is intended.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Bg2: White clearly intends to play for the central light squares.
moves.4... Bb4: Balck counters with an aggressive move.
moves.5. Nd5: Posting the Knight to a strong outpost.
moves.5... Nxd5 6. cxd5: In exchanging, White attacks the Black Knight and begins preparing a pitfall.
moves.6... Nd4: Rather than retreat, Black remains aggressive.
moves.7. e3: Leaving Black one safe and one fatal alternative.
moves.7... Nf5: The wrong choice. 7... N-N4 was the correct move.
moves.8. Qg4: Forking both pieces. Black resigns at once.
